page.title: 16PENCREBAR HOUSE
page.content: This white{Victorian manor house stands majestically at the top of Newbridge Hill between Pencrebar Farm and the A390. It is square in shape and hidden by the trees and ornamental shrubs forming the 34 acre gardens. Pencrebar was built in{1848}by {William Horndon,}but the most famous occupants were the{Foot family. Isaac {Foot,}methodist, historian, Liberal politician and one time mayor of Plymouth bought the house in{1927.}It was the venue for important Liberal garden parties and Methodist gatherings until his death in{1960}_ and also the home of his 52,000 books (now at the University of California) {Michael Foot}(Labour party leader),{Sir Dingle Foot}Q.C. and{Lord {Caradon}(Governor of Jamaica) all have their roots at Pencrebar.
